values.authorQuote: The truth is: Belonging starts with self-acceptance. Your level of belonging, in fact, can never be greater than your level of self-acceptance, because believing that you're enough is what gives you the courage to be authentic, vulnerable and imperfect.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: When you get to a place where you understand that love and belonging, your worthiness, is a birthright and not something you have to earn, anything is possible.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: Perfectionism is not the same thing as striving to be our best. Perfectionism is not about healthy achievement and growth; it's a shield.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: Vulnerability is about showing up and being seen. It's tough to do that when we're terrified about what people might see or think.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: Normally, when someone we love is turning away from a struggle, we self-protect by also turning away. That's definitely my first response. I think change is more likely to happen if both partners have common language and a shared lens to see problems.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: As unique as we all are, an awful lot of us want the same things. We want to shake up our current less-than-fulfilling lives. We want to be happier, more loving, forgiving and connected with the people around us.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: To me, a leader is someone who holds her- or himself accountable for finding potential in people and processes. And so what I think is really important is sustainability.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: Vulnerability is the birthplace of connection and the path to the feeling of worthiness. If it doesn't feel vulnerable, the sharing is probably not constructive.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: Daring to set boundaries is about having the courage to love ourselves, even when we risk disappointing others.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: If you think dealing with issues like worthiness and authenticity and vulnerability are not worthwhile because there are more pressing issues, like the bottom line or attendance or standardized test scores, you are sadly, sadly mistaken. It underpins everything.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: Shame is the most powerful, master emotion. It's the fear that we're not good enough.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: Live-tweeting your bikini wax is not vulnerability. Nor is posting a blow-by-blow of your divorce . That's an attempt to hot-wire connection. But you can't cheat real connection. It's built up slowly. It's about trust and time.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: Through my research, I found that vulnerability is the glue that holds relationships together. It's the magic sauce.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: Vulnerability is not weakness. And that myth is profoundly dangerous.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: What's the greater risk? Letting go of what people think - or letting go of how I feel, what I believe, and who I am?
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: I think our capacity for wholeheartedness can never be greater than our willingness to be broken-hearted. It means engaging with the world from a place of vulnerability and worthiness.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: The best marriages are the ones where we can go out in the world and really put ourselves out there. A lot of times we'll fail, and sometimes we'll pull it off. But good marriages are when you can go home and know that your vulnerability will be honored as courage, and that you'll find support.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: Maybe stories are just data with a soul.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: I'm not a parenting expert. In fact, I'm not sure that I even believe in the idea of 'parenting experts.' I'm an engaged, imperfect parent and a passionate researcher. I'm an experienced mapmaker and a stumbling traveler. Like many of you, parenting is by far my boldest and most daring adventure.
values.author: Brene Brown
values.authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

values.authorQuote: The greatest gift that you can give to others is the gift of unconditional love and acceptance.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: Develop an attitude of gratitude, and give thanks for everything that happens to you, knowing that every step forward is a step toward achieving something bigger and better than your current situation.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: Move out of your comfort zone. You can only grow if you are willing to feel awkward and uncomfortable when you try something new.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, 'What's in it for me?'
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: Goals allow you to control the direction of change in your favor.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: You cannot control what happens to you, but you can control your attitude toward what happens to you, and in that, you will be mastering change rather than allowing it to master you.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: Communication is a skill that you can learn. It's like riding a bicycle or typing. If you're willing to work at it, you can rapidly improve the quality of evry part of your life.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: Teamwork is so important that it is virtually impossible for you to reach the heights of your capabilities or make the money that you want without becoming very good at it.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: I've found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances. Be more active. Show up more often.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: The more credit you give away, the more will come back to you. The more you help others, the more they will want to help you.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: The happiest people in the world are those who feel absolutely terrific about themselves, and this is the natural outgrowth of accepting total responsibility for every part of their life.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: Successful people are simply those with successful habits.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: The true measure of the value of any business leader and manager is performance.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: The person we believe ourselves to be will always act in a manner consistent with our self-image.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: There is no real limit to how much better a person who really commits to getting better can get. Every manager has the potential to become an excellent manager for the rest of his or her career.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: Those people who develop the ability to continuously acquire new and better forms of knowledge that they can apply to their work and to their lives will be the movers and shakers in our society for the indefinite future.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: You can become an even more excellent person by constantly setting higher and higher standards for yourself and then by doing everything possible to live up to those standards.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: All successful people men and women are big dreamers. They imagine what their future could be, ideal in every respect, and then they work every day toward their distant vision, that goal or purpose.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: Decisiveness is a characteristic of high-performing men and women. Almost any decision is better than no decision at all.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: Whatever we expect with confidence becomes our own self-fulfilling prophecy.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: You have to put in many, many, many tiny efforts that nobody sees or appreciates before you achieve anything worthwhile.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: Relationships are the hallmark of the mature person.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: You have within you right now, everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: Only by contending with challenges that seem to be beyond your strength to handle at the moment you can grow more surely toward the stars.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: Managers today have to do more with less, and get better results from limited resources, more than ever before.
values.author: Brian Tracy

values.authorQuote: If you love life, don't waste time, for time is what life is made up of.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: Always be yourself, express yourself, have faith in yourself, do not go out and look for a successful personality and duplicate it.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: Knowledge will give you power, but character respect.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: If you always put limit on everything you do, physical or anything else. It will spread into your work and into your life. There are no limits. There are only plateaus, and you must not stay there, you must go beyond them.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame, very pretty, often hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. As love grows older, our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals, deep-burning and unquenchable.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: Showing off is the fool's idea of glory.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: A goal is not always meant to be reached, it often serves simply as something to aim at.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: The less effort, the faster and more powerful you will be.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: As you think, so shall you become.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: It's not the daily increase but daily decrease. Hack away at the unessential.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: I fear not the man who has practiced 10,000 kicks once, but I fear the man who has practiced one kick 10,000 times.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: Ever since I was a child I have had this instinctive urge for expansion and growth. To me, the function and duty of a quality human being is the sincere and honest development of one's potential.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: The key to immortality is first living a life worth remembering.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: Take things as they are. Punch when you have to punch. Kick when you have to kick.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: Real living is living for others.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: To hell with circumstances; I create opportunities.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: Obey the principles without being bound by them.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: Notice that the stiffest tree is most easily cracked, while the bamboo or willow survives by bending with the wind.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: The possession of anything begins in the mind.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: You just wait. I'm going to be the biggest Chinese Star in the world.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: Take no thought of who is right or wrong or who is better than. Be not for or against.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: To me, the extraordinary aspect of martial arts lies in its simplicity. The easy way is also the right way, and martial arts is nothing at all special; the closer to the true way of martial arts, the less wastage of expression there is.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: To know oneself is to study oneself in action with another person.
values.author: Bruce Lee
values.authorOccupation: Martial artist, philosopher, actor, director, screenwriter, producer

values.authorQuote: I have spent my life judging the distance between American reality and the American dream.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: When it comes to luck, you make your own.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: It's a sad man my friend who's livin' in his own skin and can't stand the company.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: And whether you're drawn to gospel music or church music or honky-tonk music, it informs your character and it informs your talent.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: You can go from doing something quite silly to something dead serious in the blink of an eye, and if you're making those connections with your audience then they're going to go right along with it.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: I played in front of every conceivable audience you could face: an all-black audience, all-white, firemen's fairs, policemen's balls, in front of supermarkets, bar mitzvahs, weddings, drive-in theaters. I'd seen it all before I ever walked into a recording studio.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: Adult life is dealing with an enormous amount of questions that don't have answers. So I let the mystery settle into my music. I don't deny anything, I don't advocate anything, I just live with it.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: I can sing very comfortably from my vantage point because a lot of the music was about a loss of innocence, there's innocence contained in you but there's also innocence in the process of being lost.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: Pessimism and optimism are slammed up against each other in my records, the tension between them is where it's all at, it's what lights the fire.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: We all have stories we're living and telling ourselves.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: Blind faith in your leaders, or in anything, will get you killed.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: Plus, you know, when I was young, there was a lot of respect for clowning in rock music - look at Little Richard. It was a part of the whole thing, and I always also believed that it released the audience.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: When I was growing up, there were two things that were unpopular in my house. One was me, and the other was my guitar.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: The release date is just one day, but the record is forever.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: Talk about a dream, try to make it real.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: The best music is essentially there to provide you something to face the world with.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: This music is forever for me. It's the stage thing, that rush moment that you live for. It never lasts, but that's what you live for.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: Your success story is a bigger story than whatever you're trying to say on stage. Success makes life easier. It doesn't make living easier.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: 'Darkness on the Edge of Town' came out of a huge body of work that had tons of very happy songs.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: Anyone who's grown up or lived on the Jersey Shore knows the place is unique.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: I suppose when you do it correctly, a good introduction and a good outro makes the song feel like it's coming out of something and then evolving into something.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: I hadn't performed by myself in a while. It feels very natural to me, and I assume people come for the very same reasons as they do when I'm with the band: to be moved, for something to happen to them.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: The audiences are there as a result of my history with the band but also as a result of my being able to reach people with a tune.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: I have my ideas, I have my music and I also just enjoy showing off, so that's a big part of it. Also, I like to get up onstage and behave insanely or express myself physically, and the band can get pretty silly.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: I do a lot of curiosity buying; I buy it if I like the album cover, I buy it if I like the name of the band, anything that sparks my imagination.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: Yeah, my son likes a lot of guitar bands. He gave me something the other day which was really good. He'll burn a CD for me full of things that he has, so he's a pretty good call if I want to check some of that stuff out... The other two aren't quite into that yet.
values.author: Bruce Springsteen

values.authorQuote: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: What we think, we become.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot live without a spiritual life.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think. When the mind is pure, joy follows like a shadow that never leaves.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: You will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: The foot feels the foot when it feels the ground.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: It is better to travel well than to arrive.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: It is a man's own mind, not his enemy or foe, that lures him to evil ways.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: To keep the body in good health is a duty... otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: There are only two mistakes one can make along the road to truth; not going all the way, and not starting.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: It is better to conquer yourself than to win a thousand battles. Then the victory is yours. It cannot be taken from you, not by angels or by demons, heaven or hell.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: I never see what has been done; I only see what remains to be done.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: Just as treasures are uncovered from the earth, so virtue appears from good deeds, and wisdom appears from a pure and peaceful mind. To walk safely through the maze of human life, one needs the light of wisdom and the guidance of virtue.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.
values.author: Budda

values.authorQuote: Education without values, as useful as it is, seems rather to make man a more clever devil.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: It may be hard for an egg to turn into a bird: it would be a jolly sight harder for it to learn to fly while remaining an egg. We are like eggs at present. And you cannot go on indefinitely being just an ordinary, decent egg. We must be hatched or go bad.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: Literature adds to reality, it does not simply describe it. It enriches the necessary competencies that daily life requires and provides; and in this respect, it irrigates the deserts that our lives have already become.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: Look for yourself, and you will find in the long run only hatred, loneliness, despair, rage, ruin, and decay. But look for Christ, and you will find Him, and with Him everything else thrown in.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: Joy is the serious business of Heaven.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: The task of the modern educator is not to cut down jungles, but to irrigate deserts.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: Failures, repeated failures, are finger posts on the road to achievement. One fails forward toward success.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: What I call my 'self' now is hardly a person at all. It's mainly a meeting place for various natural forces, desires, and fears, etcetera, some of which come from my ancestors, and some from my education, some perhaps from devils. The self you were really intended to be is something that lives not from nature but from God.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: Courage is not simply one of the virtues, but the form of every virtue at the testing point.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things that give value to survival.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: Aim at heaven and you will get earth thrown in. Aim at earth and you get neither.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: We must show our Christian colors if we are to be true to Jesus Christ.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: There are two kinds of people: those who say to God, 'Thy will be done,' and those to whom God says, 'All right, then, have it your way.'
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: A man who is eating or lying with his wife or preparing to go to sleep in humility, thankfulness and temperance, is, by Christian standards, in an infinitely higher state than one who is listening to Bach or reading Plato in a state of pride.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: Has this world been so kind to you that you should leave with regret? There are better things ahead than any we leave behind.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: An explanation of cause is not a justification by reason.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: Eros will have naked bodies; Friendship naked personalities.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: We are what we believe we are.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: Let's pray that the human race never escapes from Earth to spread its iniquity elsewhere.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: Miracles are a retelling in small letters of the very same story which is written across the whole world in letters too large for some of us to see.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: History isn't just the story of bad people doing bad things. It's quite as much a story of people trying to do good things. But somehow, something goes wrong.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning: just as, if there were no light in the universe and therefore no creatures with eyes, we should never know it was dark. Dark would be without meaning.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: Writing is like a 'lust,' or like 'scratching when you itch.' Writing comes as a result of a very strong impulse, and when it does come, I, for one, must get it out.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: God cannot give us a happiness and peace apart from Himself, because it is not there. There is no such thing.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: Satan, the leader or dictator of devils, is the opposite, not of God, but of Michael.
values.author: C. S. Lewis

values.authorQuote: Nothing in this world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not: nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education will not: the world is full of educated derelicts. Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers. It may not be difficult to store up in the mind a vast quantity of facts within a comparatively short time, but the ability to form judgments requires the severe discipline of hard work and the tempering heat of experience and maturity.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: All growth depends upon activity. There is no development physically or intellectually without effort, and effort means work.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: No person was ever honored for what he received. Honor has been the reward for what he gave.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: I have never been hurt by what I have not said.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Christmas is not a time nor a season, but a state of mind. To cherish peace and goodwill, to be plenteous in mercy, is to have the real spirit of Christmas.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: It takes a great man to be a good listener.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: To live under the American Constitution is the greatest political privilege that was ever accorded to the human race.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: There is no dignity quite so impressive, and no one independence quite so important, as living within your means.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: When more and more people are thrown out of work, unemployment results.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Don't expect to build up the weak by pulling down the strong.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Heroism is not only in the man, but in the occasion.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: I have noticed that nothing I never said ever did me any harm.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Industry, thrift and self-control are not sought because they create wealth, but because they create character.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: We cannot do everything at once, but we can do something at once.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: We do not need more intellectual power, we need more spiritual power. We do not need more of the things that are seen, we need more of the things that are unseen.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Little progress can be made by merely attempting to repress what is evil. Our great hope lies in developing what is good.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: I have found it advisable not to give too much heed to what people say when I am trying to accomplish something of consequence. Invariably they proclaim it can't be done. I deem that the very best time to make the effort.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: If you see ten troubles coming down the road, you can be sure that nine will run into the ditch before they reach you.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Those who trust to chance must abide by the results of chance.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: I sometimes wish that people would put a little more emphasis upon the observance of the law than they do upon its enforcement.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: One with the law is a majority.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Men speak of natural rights, but I challenge any one to show where in nature any rights existed or were recognized until there was established for their declaration and protection a duly promulgated body of corresponding laws.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: There is no force so democratic as the force of an ideal.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Civilization and profit go hand in hand.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: We need more of the Office Desk and less of the Show Window in politics. Let men in office substitute the midnight oil for the limelight.
values.author: Calvin Coolidge
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, lawyer

values.authorQuote: The word 'happy' would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: One looks back with appreciation to the brilliant teachers, but with gratitude to those who touched our human feelings. The curriculum is so much necessary raw material, but warmth is the vital element for the growing plant and for the soul of the child.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: Children are educated by what the grown-up is and not by his talk.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word happy would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness. It is far better take things as they come along with patience and equanimity.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: Every form of addiction is bad, no matter whether the narcotic be alcohol or morphine or idealism.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: The creation of something new is not accomplished by the intellect but by the play instinct acting from inner necessity. The creative mind plays with the objects it loves.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: When an inner situation is not made conscious, it appears outside as fate.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: As far as we can discern, the sole purpose of human existence is to kindle a light in the darkness of mere being.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: There is no birth of consciousness without pain.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: We are born at a given moment, in a given place and, like vintage years of wine, we have the qualities of the year and of the season of which we are born. Astrology does not lay claim to anything more.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: We cannot change anything until we accept it. Condemnation does not liberate, it oppresses.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: Neurosis is always a substitute for legitimate suffering.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: The healthy man does not torture others - generally it is the tortured who turn into torturers.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: The pendulum of the mind alternates between sense and nonsense, not between right and wrong.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: Where love rules, there is no will to power; and where power predominates, there love is lacking. The one is the shadow of the other.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: Grounded in the natural philosophy of the Middle Ages, alchemy formed a bridge: on the one hand into the past, to Gnosticism, and on the other into the future, to the modern psychology of the unconscious.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: Man's task is to become conscious of the contents that press upward from the unconscious.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: Understanding does not cure evil, but it is a definite help, inasmuch as one can cope with a comprehensible darkness.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: It all depends on how we look at things, and not how they are in themselves.
values.author: Carl Jung

values.authorQuote: We live in a society exquisitely dependent on science and technology, in which hardly anyone knows anything about science and technology.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: Who are we? We find that we live on an insignificant planet of a humdrum star lost in a galaxy tucked away in some forgotten corner of a universe in which there are far more galaxies than people.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were. But without it we go nowhere.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: Absence of evidence is not evidence of absence.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: Extinction is the rule. Survival is the exception.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: It is far better to grasp the universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: We've arranged a civilization in which most crucial elements profoundly depend on science and technology.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: Our species needs, and deserves, a citizenry with minds wide awake and a basic understanding of how the world works.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: If you wish to make an apple pie from scratch, you must first invent the universe.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: Personally, I would be delighted if there were a life after death, especially if it permitted me to continue to learn about this world and others, if it gave me a chance to discover how history turns out.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: The universe seems neither benign nor hostile, merely indifferent.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: We have also arranged things so that almost no one understands science and technology. This is a prescription for disaster. We might get away with it for a while, but sooner or later this combustible mixture of ignorance and power is going to blow up in our faces.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: If we long to believe that the stars rise and set for us, that we are the reason there is a Universe, does science do us a disservice in deflating our conceits?
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: But the fact that some geniuses were laughed at does not imply that all who are laughed at are geniuses. They laughed at Columbus, they laughed at Fulton, they laughed at the Wright Brothers. But they also laughed at Bozo the Clown.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: When you make the finding yourself - even if you're the last person on Earth to see the light - you'll never forget it.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: A celibate clergy is an especially good idea, because it tends to suppress any hereditary propensity toward fanaticism.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: The brain is like a muscle. When it is in use we feel very good. Understanding is joyous.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: All of the books in the world contain no more information than is broadcast as video in a single large American city in a single year. Not all bits have equal value.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: For me, it is far better to grasp the Universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: The universe is not required to be in perfect harmony with human ambition.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: I am often amazed at how much more capability and enthusiasm for science there is among elementary school youngsters than among college students.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: I can find in my undergraduate classes, bright students who do not know that the stars rise and set at night, or even that the Sun is a star.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: Skeptical scrutiny is the means, in both science and religion, by which deep thoughts can be winnowed from deep nonsense.
values.author: Carl Sagan
values.authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

values.authorQuote: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: We don't stop going to school when we graduate.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: It's also selfish because it makes you feel good when you help others. I've been helped by acts of kindness from strangers. That's why we're here, after all, to help others.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: Everybody I know who is funny, it's in them. You can teach timing, or some people are able to tell a joke, though I don't like to tell jokes. But I think you have to be born with a sense of humor and a sense of timing.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: Words, once they are printed, have a life of their own.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: Because nobody goes through life without a scar.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: My grandmother and I followed my mother here, to a house a block north of Hollywood Boulevard but a million miles away from Hollywood, if you know what I mean. We would hang out behind the ropes and look at the movie stars arriving at the premieres.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: My grandmother and I would go see movies, and we'd come back to the apartment - we had a one-room apartment in Hollywood - and I would kind of lock myself in this little dressing room area with a cracked mirror on the door and act out what I had just seen.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: I was once asked to do my Tarzan yell at Bergdorf Goodman, and a guard burst in with a gun! Now I only do it under controlled circumstances.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: You have to go through the falling down in order to learn to walk. It helps to know that you can survive it. That's an education in itself.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: Adolescence is just one big walking pimple.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: I'm really not that funny in real life! But I am the best audience one could find. I love to laugh.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: I'm glad I was born when I was. My time was the golden age of variety. If I were starting out again now, maybe things would happen for me, but it certainly would not be on a variety show with 28 musicians, 12 dancers, two major guest stars, 50 costumes a week by Bob Mackie. The networks just wouldn't spend the money today.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: I love the writing. I love the idea of typing and seeing it on the computer and printing it out myself and, you know, moving sentences around. I like that.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: I'm not always optimistic. You wouldn't have all cylinders cooking if you were always like Mary Poppins.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: On the good days, my mother would haul out the ukulele and we'd sit around the kitchen table - it was a cardboard table with a linoleum top - and sing.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: Celebrity was a long time in coming; it will go away. Everything goes away.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: I don't have false teeth. Do you think I'd buy teeth like these?
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: Comedy is tragedy - plus time.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: My grandmother and I saw an average of eight movies a week, double features, second run.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: It costs a lot to sue a magazine, and it's too bad that we don't have a system where the losing team has to pay the winning team's lawyers.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: You know, one wonderful thing that came out of my Enquirer experience is that, in my case, it was ruled tabloids are magazines. Which means they didn't have the protection that a newspaper has.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: But I don't begrudge anybody, because I know how hard it is to have that dream and to make it happen, whether or not it's just to put a roof over your head and food on the table.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: I wish my mother had left me something about how she felt growing up. I wish my grandmother had done the same. I wanted my girls to know me.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: I think the hardest thing to do in the world, show-business-wise, is write comedy.
values.author: Carol Burnett

values.authorQuote: We cannot seek achievement for ourselves and forget about progress and prosperity for our community... Our ambitions must be broad enough to include the aspirations and needs of others, for their sakes and for our own.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: We need to help students and parents cherish and preserve the ethnic and cultural diversity that nourishes and strengthens this community - and this nation.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: Our language is the reflection of ourselves. A language is an exact reflection of the character and growth of its speakers.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: Preservation of one's own culture does not require contempt or disrespect for other cultures.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: The fight is never about grapes or lettuce. It is always about people.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: You are never strong enough that you don't need help.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: Students must have initiative; they should not be mere imitators. They must learn to think and act for themselves - and be free.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: There is no such thing as defeat in non-violence.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: From the depth of need and despair, people can work together, can organize themselves to solve their own problems and fill their own needs with dignity and strength.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: We draw our strength from the very despair in which we have been forced to live. We shall endure.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: Real education should consist of drawing the goodness and the best out of our own students. What better books can there be than the book of humanity?
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: There is no substitute for hard work, 23 or 24 hours a day. And there is no substitute for patience and acceptance.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: There are vivid memories from my childhood - what we had to go through because of low wages and the conditions, basically because there was no union. I suppose, if I wanted to be fair, I could say that I'm trying to settle a personal score. I could dramatize it by saying that I want to bring social justice to farm workers.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: In some cases non-violence requires more militancy than violence.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: When we are really honest with ourselves we must admit our lives are all that really belong to us. So it is how we use our lives that determines the kind of men we are.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: It is possible to become discouraged about the injustice we see everywhere. But God did not promise us that the world would be humane and just. He gives us the gift of life and allows us to choose the way we will use our limited time on earth. It is an awesome opportunity.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: Though many of the poor have come to see the affluent middle class as its enemy, that class actually stands between the poor and the real powers in this society - the administrative octopus with its head in Washington, the conglomerates, the military complex.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: It is my deepest belief that only by giving our lives do we find life. I am convinced that the truest act of courage, the strongest act of manliness is to sacrifice ourselves for others in a totally non-violent struggle for justice.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: Who gets the risks? The risks are given to the consumer, the unsuspecting consumer and the poor work force. And who gets the benefits? The benefits are only for the corporations, for the money makers.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: If you really want to make a friend, go to someone's house and eat with him... the people who give you their food give you their heart.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: The end of all knowledge should be service to others.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: We farm workers are closest to food production. We were the first to recognize the serious health hazards of agriculture pesticides to both consumers and ourselves.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: To be a man is to suffer for others. God help us to be men!
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: There is no law for farm labor organizing, save the law of the jungle.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: When poor people get involved in a long conflict, such as a strike or a civil rights drive, and the pressure increases each day, there is a deep need for spiritual advice. Without it, we see families crumble, leadership weaken, and hard workers grow tired.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: What we do know absolutely is that human lives are worth more than grapes and that innocent-looking grapes on the table may disguise poisonous residues hidden deep inside where washing cannot reach.
values.author: Cesar Chavez

values.authorQuote: A good wife is one who serves her husband in the morning like a mother does, loves him in the day like a sister does and pleases him like a prostitute in the night.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: The fragrance of flowers spreads only in the direction of the wind. But the goodness of a person spreads in all directions.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: God is not present in idols. Your feelings are your god. The soul is your temple.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: Books are as useful to a stupid person as a mirror is useful to a blind person.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: Education is the best friend. An educated person is respected everywhere. Education beats the beauty and the youth.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: The world's biggest power is the youth and beauty of a woman.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: Even if a snake is not poisonous, it should pretend to be venomous.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: The biggest guru-mantra is: never share your secrets with anybody. It will destroy you.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: As soon as the fear approaches near, attack and destroy it.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: Purity of speech, of the mind, of the senses, and of a compassionate heart are needed by one who desires to rise to the divine platform.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: A man is great by deeds, not by birth.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: There is poison in the fang of the serpent, in the mouth of the fly and in the sting of a scorpion; but the wicked man is saturated with it.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: Treat your kid like a darling for the first five years. For the next five years, scold them. By the time they turn sixteen, treat them like a friend. Your grown up children are your best friends.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: He who is overly attached to his family members experiences fear and sorrow, for the root of all grief is attachment. Thus one should discard attachment to be happy.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: We should not fret for what is past, nor should we be anxious about the future; men of discernment deal only with the present moment.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: A person should not be too honest. Straight trees are cut first and honest people are screwed first.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: It is better to die than to preserve this life by incurring disgrace. The loss of life causes but a moment's grief, but disgrace brings grief every day of one's life.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: The one excellent thing that can be learned from a lion is that whatever a man intends doing should be done by him with a whole-hearted and strenuous effort.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: Do not reveal what you have thought upon doing, but by wise council keep it secret being determined to carry it into execution.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: The earth is supported by the power of truth; it is the power of truth that makes the sun shine and the winds blow; indeed all things rest upon truth.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: There is no austerity equal to a balanced mind, and there is no happiness equal to contentment; there is no disease like covetousness, and no virtue like mercy.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: As a single withered tree, if set aflame, causes a whole forest to burn, so does a rascal son destroy a whole family.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: He who lives in our mind is near though he may actually be far away; but he who is not in our heart is far though he may really be nearby.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: The life of an uneducated man is as useless as the tail of a dog which neither covers its rear end, nor protects it from the bites of insects.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: If one has a good disposition, what other virtue is needed? If a man has fame, what is the value of other ornamentation?
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: Once you start a working on something, don't be afraid of failure and don't abandon it. People who work sincerely are the happiest.
values.author: Chanakya
values.authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist

values.authorQuote: Depending on the story that you're telling, you can be relatable to everybody or nobody. I try and tell everybody's story.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: With 'Acid Rap,' I allowed myself to be really open-minded and free with who I allowed into my musical space. I wanted to make a cohesive product, but I also just want to make a bunch of dope songs inspired by whatever sounds I liked.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: There's a hunger in me that always wants to be creating and orating, telling people something and giving them information and getting feedback. There are so many questions that I'm trying to ask, and I'm still so far from being done saying what I gotta say.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: Kanye took me from a kid who listened to music to a kid who lived music.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: I don't know where people think I'm from, but I'm from Chicago. It's really just that. People wanna romanticize it and say, 'There's two sides to it, and it's a beautiful love/hate story of violence and music.' But it's really just a very scummy place where people don't have respect for other people's lives.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: I think it's so dope that I'm here in Chicago and contributing to the music scene that's thriving. People are so happy Chicago's shining that everyone is willing to say 'I represent Chicago.' That wasn't always the case.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: The idea of 'talking white,' a lot of people grew up around that, just the idea that if you speak with proper diction and come off as educated that it's not black and that it's actually anti-black and should be considered only something that white people would do.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: It wasn't until I left that I realised it's not weird to grow up in certain cities and, by the age of 27 or 28, for all of your friends to still be alive. I can think of a lot of kids that I knew in Chicago who were supposed to grow up but didn't.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: When you're a Chicago artist, to play Lollapalooza, that's not a normal thing. It's artists on a path to a certain place that do that. Chief Keef did it; Kids These Days did it; Cool Kids did it. And I'm the next Cool-Kids-Chief, if you will.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: I don't really like meetings, I like recording and performing music. I need to set myself up for when the time does come that I need better distribution or just a bigger team behind me.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: Both of my parents graduated from high school, both attended college, both have government jobs now. They've always been very adamant about me finishing high school and finishing college.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: I think even before I knew I wanted to be a rapper, I wanted to be an entertainer. I was really into Michael Jackson as a kid.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: There's nothing like doing a show at home. When you do a show in Chicago, there's just a certain love that you don't feel anywhere else; it's like home base.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: The weird thing about rap is that you don't get compared in the same way that athletes do, even though it's probably the most competitive sport in music. In basketball, they look at a player and say: 'This guy was the best in his prime at this sport.' But in rap it's not until you're dead or retired that people think about it like that.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: People wanna say that they're part Native American or mixed, or anything other than black. We're raised to believe that there's something better about not being fully black, something eccentric about it. I'm saying I used to tell girls that I was mixed, which is a bold-faced lie!
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: Jeremih has been my favorite artist to collab with.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: 'Chance the Rapper' is many things. I'm constantly evolving.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: People always tell me I'm the complete opposite of Chief Keef and act like I'm supposed to stop him from making his music. But I like Chief Keef, so it's always super awkward. I just make music I like.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: Fame or perceived success - it all comes from groupthink.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: Music can kind of make you one-dimensional. People see what's on the surface and what you rap about, and they make their decision on who you are from there.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: One of the first times I ever performed in front of a big group of people was at my kindergarten graduation. I did, like, a Michael Jackson impersonation as, like, a five year old. I had the suit and blazer, the glove and the fedora, and I just performed a whole Michael Jackson song. I'm sure it was 'Smooth Criminal.'
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: The whole point of 'Acid Rap' was just to ask people a question: does the music business side of this dictate what type of project this is? If it's all original music and it's got this much emotion around it and it connects this way with this many people, is it a mixtape? What's an 'album' these days, anyways?
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: I made the decision that I was going to make rap music in, like, fourth grade, so it's been something I was saying for a long time.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: I'm light skinned, and I used to lean on that because that's something a lot of black people pride themselves on, and it's weird.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: I don't really have control over my direct impression on people anymore. I used to be the person putting my CD in people's hands. But I'm kind of a mainstream artist now. Not by choice.
values.author: Chance The Rapper

values.authorQuote: Censorship is the tool of those who have the need to hide actualities from themselves and from others. Their fear is only their inability to face what is real, and I can't vent any anger against them; I only feel this appalling sadness. Somewhere in their upbringing, they were shielded against the total facts of our existence.
values.author: Charles Bukowski
values.authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist

values.authorQuote: We're all going to die, all of us; what a circus! That alone should make us love each other, but it doesn't. We are terrorized and flattened by trivialities. We are eaten up by nothing.

values.authorQuote: Some people never go crazy, What truly horrible lives they must live.

values.authorQuote: It's possible to love a human being if you don't know them too well.

values.authorQuote: Never envy a man his lady. Behind it all lays a living hell.

values.author: Charles Bukowski

values.authorQuote: Joan of Arc had style. Jesus had style.

values.authorQuote: The thing that I fear discriminating against is humor and truth.

values.authorQuote: Writers have to put up with this editor thing; it is ageless and eternal and wrong.

values.authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist

values.authorQuote: A cat is only itself, representative of the strong forces of life that won't let go.

values.authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist

values.authorQuote: I kept writing not because I felt I was so good, but because I felt they were so bad, including Shakespeare, all those. The stilted formalism, like chewing cardboard.

values.authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist

values.authorQuote: I would be married, but I'd have no wife, I would be married to a single life.
values.author: Charles Bukowski
values.authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist

values.authorQuote: The free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.
values.author: Charles Bukowski
values.authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist

values.authorQuote: I can relax with bums because I am a bum. I don't like laws, morals, religions, rules. I don't like to be shaped by society.

values.authorQuote: I don't like jail, they got the wrong kind of bars in there.

values.authorQuote: A man's friendships are one of the best measures of his worth.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does knowledge: it is those who know little, and not those who know much, who so positively assert that this or that problem will never be solved by science.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: Animals, whom we have made our slaves, we do not like to consider our equal.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: False facts are highly injurious to the progress of science, for they often endure long; but false views, if supported by some evidence, do little harm, for every one takes a salutary pleasure in proving their falseness.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: The very essence of instinct is that it's followed independently of reason.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: To kill an error is as good a service as, and sometimes even better than, the establishing of a new truth or fact.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: The mystery of the beginning of all things is insoluble by us; and I for one must be content to remain an agnostic.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: We can allow satellites, planets, suns, universe, nay whole systems of universes, to be governed by laws, but the smallest insect, we wish to be created at once by special act.

values.authorQuote: How paramount the future is to the present when one is surrounded by children.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: I love fools' experiments. I am always making them.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: An American monkey, after getting drunk on brandy, would never touch it again, and thus is much wiser than most men.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: My mind seems to have become a kind of machine for grinding general laws out of large collections of facts.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: I have called this principle, by which each slight variation, if useful, is preserved, by the term of Natural Selection.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: A moral being is one who is capable of reflecting on his past actions and their motives - of approving of some and disapproving of others.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: I have tried lately to read Shakespeare, and found it so intolerably dull that it nauseated me.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: It is a cursed evil to any man to become as absorbed in any subject as I am in mine.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: On the ordinary view of each species having been independently created, we gain no scientific explanation.

values.authorQuote: Man is descended from a hairy, tailed quadruped, probably arboreal in its habits.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: Man tends to increase at a greater rate than his means of subsistence.

values.authorQuote: The highest possible stage in moral culture is when we recognize that we ought to control our thoughts.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: At some future period, not very distant as measured by centuries, the civilized races of man will almost certainly exterminate, and replace the savage races throughout the world.

values.authorQuote: If the misery of the poor be caused not by the laws of nature, but by our institutions, great is our sin.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: What a book a devil's chaplain might write on the clumsy, wasteful, blundering, low, and horribly cruel work of nature!

values.authorQuote: We must, however, acknowledge, as it seems to me, that man with all his noble qualities... still bears in his bodily frame the indelible stamp of his lowly origin.
values.author: Charles Darwin

values.authorQuote: The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.

values.authorQuote: It was one of those March days when the sun shines hot and the wind blows cold: when it is summer in the light, and winter in the shade.

values.authorQuote: Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.
values.author: Charles Dickens

values.authorQuote: Nature gives to every time and season some beauties of its own; and from morning to night, as from the cradle to the grave, it is but a succession of changes so gentle and easy that we can scarcely mark their progress.

values.authorQuote: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.

values.authorQuote: I never could have done what I have done without the habits of punctuality, order, and diligence, without the determination to concentrate myself on one subject at a time.

values.author: Charles Dickens

values.authorQuote: Whatever I have tried to do in life, I have tried with all my heart to do it well; whatever I have devoted myself to, I have devoted myself completely; in great aims and in small I have always thoroughly been in earnest.

values.authorQuote: If there were no bad people, there would be no good lawyers.

values.authorQuote: There is nothing so strong or safe in an emergency of life as the simple truth.

values.authorQuote: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.

values.authorQuote: There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts.

values.authorQuote: We forge the chains we wear in life.

values.author: Charles Dickens

values.authorQuote: It opens the lungs, washes the countenance, exercises the eyes, and softens down the temper; so cry away.

values.authorQuote: I will honor Christmas in my heart, and try to keep it all the year.

values.authorQuote: The civility which money will purchase, is rarely extended to those who have none.

values.authorQuote: He would make a lovely corpse.

values.authorQuote: The difference between something good and something great is attention to detail.

values.authorQuote: Attitude is more important than the past, than education, than money, than circumstances, than what people do or say. It is more important than appearance, giftedness, or skill.

values.authorQuote: Prejudice is a learned trait. You're not born prejudiced; you're taught it.

values.authorQuote: A teardrop on earth summons the King of heaven.
